column4: I try pinging things in Ubuntu, and get "destination host unreachable". What to do?
go to system >> administration >> network tools, select the traceroute tab, type in google.com, paste the results to pastebin and report back
if you still need help "sudo apt-get install traceroute" "traceroute google.com" copy paste to pastebin, post the link
boot up the live cd, and if you can connect to the internet you're fine
... wasnt able to before when i tried...
you weren't able to boot from the CD? Did you try changing the boot order in your bios settings?
I could boot from the CD, I couldnt get internet from the live cd, I mean.
no sites, cant even ping the router's IP
alright, well, i'll have to brb then to try this, because its a dual boot on this machine....
hey I think I can help you
alright... brb then. have to switch back to ubuntu.
it might be a problem with your router, tried updating the firmware?
the router is fine. i can connect perfectly fine through xp
